programme.title: Tamtej nocy
programme.desc: Zuzanna Szwarc (Hanna Konarowska), mama kilkuletniej dziewczynki, pracuje jako kuratorka sztuki. Pewnego wieczoru widzi napad. Dwóch mężczyzna atakuje chłopaka. Zuza nie pozostaje obojętna i stara się go obronić. Kiedy na miejsce przybywa policja, to jednak ona, nie sprawcy pobicia, zostaje aresztowana.

programme.title: Kurs
programme.desc: Do taksówki znajdującej się na dworcu, wsiada pewien mężczyzna (Łukasz Nowicki). Początkowo luźna rozmowa między taksówkarzem (Grzegorz Kowalczyk) a pasażerem obiera inny tor. Tematy rozmów stają się coraz bardziej osobiste.

programme.title: Niepospolita
programme.desc: Rok 1939. Pisarz Tadeusz Dołęga-Mostowicz (Patryk Szwichtenberg) podróżuje po Polsce ze swoją asystentką Dianą (Agata Różycka). Przeprowadza wywiady z ludźmi, którzy osiągnęli sukces w różnych dziedzinach. Na swojej drodze spotyka m.in. Melchiora Wańkowicza (Marek Karpowicz), Janusza Kusocińskiego, Eugeniusza Kwiatkowskiego i Hankę Ordonównę.

programme.title: We mnie
programme.desc: Sandra (Małgorzata Gorol) świętuje swój wieczór panieński. Zbliża się dzień ślubu, ale przedtem musi poddać się aborcji - płód ma wady genetyczne. Do szpitala jedzie z nią narzeczony. Z każdą kolejną minutą mężczyzna wydaje się Sandrze coraz bardziej obcy. Po zabiegu kobieta postanawia szczerze z nim porozmawiać.

programme.title: Transfer kosmicznej energii
programme.desc: Radek jest ambitnym coachem motywacyjnym. Robi karierę w korporacji. Mężczyzna traci pewność siebie w momencie, gdy uczestniczy w bójce w knajpie. Decyduje się na nielegalne techniki hakowania mózgu. Niestety rezultaty są inne, niż się spodziewał.

Master of the Classe
programme.desc: Berry (Sébastien Chassagne) ma 35 lat i dopiero niedawno dostał pracę jako stażysta w gimnazjum. Jego marzenie o stabilnym zatrudnieniu zostaje poddane próbie. Pewnego dnia ma się odbyć inspekcja jego lekcji, której wynik zadecyduje o tym, czy mężczyzna zdobędzie stałą posadę.

credits.actor: Sébastien Chassagne

programme.title: Code of the Freaks
Kodeks dziwolągów
Code of the Freaks
programme.desc: Code of the Freaks: Directed by Salome Chasnoff. With Lawrence Carter-Long, Candace Coleman, Mike Ervin, Mat Fraser. This documentary examines the representation of disabled people in Hollywood movies." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10411858/","name":"Code of the Freaks","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDEwMWU5ZjQtMjgyYS00M2RmLWEyYzYtMDM1ZmYzNWM3MTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU4MTQ0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This documentary examines the representation of disabled people in Hollywood movies.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10411858/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jramirez-66906"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Most Accurate Documentary About Disability in the Movies","reviewBody":"The documentary examines the misconceptions about the portrayal of characters with disabilities in the movies from actual advocates, writers, actors and historians who have examined more than 100 years of the cinema's view on disability. I found the range of topics going from: sex and disability, race and disability, the false message of inspirational story of a disabled person, deaf character stereotypes, blind character stereotypes, blindness as a superpower, and the so-called "happy ending" or resolution to a story of a character with a disability. The so-called "happy ending" can go in two or three ways: the disabled person has to be killed or cut off from life to restore order, the disabled person is institutionalized as a way to protect themselves from the outside world, or the disabled person is cured and does not need any form of special needs or guidance in the world. It is an insightful and in-depth documentary that makes you want to re-think about how Hollywood and movie's portrayal of disabled characters in movies can not only be misleading, but also dangerous to the disabled community in general. Hollywood must not rely on the same old stories of relying on disabled people as inspirational or cliched-stereotypes of characters who are villainous or victimized or pitied. But, one day that there will be a film with actual disabled people that are not inspirational, but living their daily lives in a humorous or ironic way that makes fun of the formula. That would be my ideal film to see when it gets made and put into a screening or a theater.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2020-04-01","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi853852185","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzU0MWU3OWItNzRiYi00ZDNhLWE2NGUtNGU2ZjM4MDJmMGY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzU0MWU3OWItNzRiYi00ZDNhLWE2NGUtNGU2ZjM4MDJmMGY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Original accessible trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4526433/","name":"Lawrence Carter-Long"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11657129/","name":"Candace Coleman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11657130/","name":"Mike Ervin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3435265/","name":"Salome Chasnoff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10730500/","name":"Susan Nussbaum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10730499/","name":"Alyson Patsavas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10730498/","name":"Carrie Sandahl"}],"duration":"PT1H8M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ma saison préférée
Moja ulubiona pora roku
Ma saison préférée
programme.desc:
Ma saison préférée: Directed by André Téchiné. With Catherine Deneuve, Daniel Auteuil, Marthe Villalonga, Jean-Pierre Bouvier. Old woman Berthe leaves her house to live in her daugter Emilie's one. Emilie and her brother Antoine have fallen out three years ago and have not seen each other since, but Emilie invites him for Christmas. Memories will come up, and will be depicted both Berthe's destiny and the strange relationship between Emilie and Antoine." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107471/","name":"Ma saison préférée","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0NzE2MzA2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDc3NTkwMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Old woman Berthe leaves her house to live in her daugter Emilie's one. Emilie and her brother Antoine have fallen out three years ago and have not seen each other since, but Emilie invites him for Christmas. Memories will come up, an","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107471/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"WilliamCKH"},"dateCreated":"2007-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great film!","reviewBody":"I first saw this film in my mid 20's and realized in hindsight that is was probably the first "adult" film I'd ever seen. These were adults coping with the realities of life, kids, marriage, relationships, an aging mother, death, etc. and not living life in an artificial, adolescent way.

The script is fascinating in that it contains so many wonderful, adult scenes. Some which come to mind immediately are: 

When the mother is talking to herself by the swimming pool, Deneuve comes in saying "why didn't you turn on the light maman?", "Are you afraid I might break something" the mother says "No, it's just that you don't know the house and you may hurt yourself", Deneuve answers. The dialogue is so strong in that you get a point of view from all characters, yet other characters see things in a totally different way and they are all valid. 

The conversation between Bruno and Emilie after his fight with Antoine about how she thinks Bruno's aged badly. How he sees their relationship and gone badly and in contrast how she sees it.

the conversations between Antoine and Emilie about putting their mother in a nursing home, how she always has to find the solutions to things and when she tries, he criticizes and she breaks down crying.

the point made by their mother at the nursing home regarding her children and modernity. How the children have grown up modern as they had wished but this curse of modernity has led them to put their aging mother into this home.

The way the mother talks so frankly about the grandchildren,"she taps on that damn piano all day, and the boy, a real half-wit." 

the close bond between her and Antoine "you don't have to fake sleeping maman, it's only me"

I also love the piece of dialogue, after the mother's funeral, where Emilie has been separated from the family and you feel it's time she goes back home and instead of announcing anything, apologizing or trying to get back to the family's good graces, she turns to her husband Bruno as a matter of factly and says "Do we have enough eggs at home?"

Brilliant writing, brilliant dialogue, superb acting. I highly recommend this truly adult movie. Wish they'd make more like this.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2004,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1993-05-14","keywords":"three word title,first person title,male objectification,male rear nudity,bare butt","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0897811/","name":"Marthe Villalonga"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022244/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094726/","name":"Pascal Bonitzer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

This is not a documentary about true police work therefore I enjoyed the super rough and laconic behavior and statements from the lead male officer/character. programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

programme.title: S*P*Y*S
Szpiegomania
S*P*Y*S
programme.desc:
S*P*Y*S: Directed by Irvin Kershner. With Elliott Gould, Donald Sutherland, Zouzou, Joss Ackland. Two spies end up being chased by the CIA, the KGB, and a group of anarchists after a botched mission invoked an unwritten "corpse for a corpse" pact." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0072107/","name":"S*P*Y*S","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2I1YTUzNDAtY2UyYS00NWQ5LWJjYjUtMmUxNGQzYWFjMzQ5L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two spies end up being chased by the CIA, the KGB, and a group of anarchists after a botched mission invoked an unwritten "corpse for a corpse" pact.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0072107/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"spookyrat1"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"This Was Screened at Cannes???","reviewBody":"Second lead pairing of Elliot Gould and Donald Sutherland (Little Murders saw them together, but with Sutherland in a support role) after the wonderful MASH in what was meant to be some sort of funny spy spoof. Alas, there is no Altmann magic with SPYS and this one sinks like the proverbial stone.

They play a mismatched spy pair who are forced to bond when sold down the river by their various agencies and thereafter chase after some micro-dots. The two still appear to have a kind of improvisational energy, but the material they are dished up to deal with, wouldn't pass muster in an average Get Smart episode. I have to say that I'm surprised the usually very competent direction of Irvin Kershner seems to have gone completely walkabout during the making of this feature. Poorly choreographed and lit action and slapstick scenes! It's difficult to believe this is the same bloke who helmed The Empire Strikes Back 6 years later. SPYS is also lumbered with a terribly annoying musical soundtrack.

In terms of laughs most discerning viewers should find any of the Roger Moore Bond entries much more amusing. And as for spoofs, the later arriving Austin Powers or Johnny English (hell, even the Casino Royale with Peter Sellers) have it all over this clunker. I would love to have been a fly on the wall to see how SPYS was received at Cannes.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":954,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1974-09-05","keywords":"hare krishna,espionage,scene during opening credits,scene during closing credits,paris france","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000661/","name":"Donald Sutherland"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001285/","name":"Elliott Gould"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958088/","name":"Zouzou"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0449984/","name":"Irvin Kershner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0032182/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067477/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0119027/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0169549/","name":"Lawrence J. programme.title: Ratujmy zakład
Pollux
programme.desc: 13-letni Vivian (Vivian Oudin) oraz Max (Maximilien Decorse) nie mogą jechać na tegoroczny obóz letni ze względu na rychłe zamknięcie fabryki, w której pracują ich rodzice. Rodzeństwo oraz ich przyjaciel z dzieciństwa, Tom (Tom-Eliott Fosse-Taurel), wpadają na pomysł, jak zarobić potrzebne pieniądze i miło spędzić wakacje. Pozostało im jednak niewiele czasu na zrealizowanie swojego planu.

London Town
programme.desc:
London Town: Directed by Derrick Borte. With Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Daniel Huttlestone, Dougray Scott, Natascha McElhone. In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1724597/","name":"London Town","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3NjU2MjYzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTk4NzgwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1724597/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"subxerogravity"},"dateCreated":"2016-10-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cool first hand story about a kid who gets introduced to The Clash (in more ways than one)","reviewBody":"I really liked Jonathan Rhys Meyers in it as Joe Strummer. It was fun to see him play a real lively character as the front man of The Clash.

The movie itself is more about how a boy named Shay is influenced by the music of the Clash while going through some hard times. His really hot mom (played by Natascha McElhone) left the family to live the life she wanted, while his father (Played by Dougray Scott), plays the classic stereotype of an adult who forgot what it was like to be young and is shifting too much responsibility on his son. 

London Town is greatly similar to another Coming-of-Age film, Sing Street (which is a little better), as Shay allows a crush on a punk rock girl to greatly influence his walk down the path of punk, which leads him to meeting Joe Strummer. 

The film's formula is very direct, and it's focus on punk rock makes it a perfect persona of the early days of the genre. It's a love letter to The Clash any fan would enjoy.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2285,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2016-10-07","keywords":"the clash,pantyhose,miniskirt,fishnet pantyhose,losing virginity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3651909145","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 70's London, a teenager is introduced to The Clash by his estranged mother and it changes his life forever."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001667/","name":"Jonathan Rhys Meyers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4948519/","name":"Daniel Huttlestone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779084/","name":"Dougray Scott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0097517/","name":"Derrick Borte"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0296298/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030755/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0375102/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0114226/","name":"Matt Brown"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0839503/","name":"Sonya Gildea"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792202/","name":"Kirsten Sheridan"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

It changes his life forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1724597/","name":"London Town","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3NjU2MjYzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTk4NzgwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1724597/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"subxerogravity","dateCreated":"2016-10-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cool first hand story about a kid who gets introduced to The Clash (in more ways than one)","reviewBody":"I really liked Jonathan Rhys Meyers in it as Joe Strummer. It was fun to see him play a real lively character as the front man of The Clash.

The movie itself is more about how a boy named Shay is influenced by the music of the Clash while going through some hard times. His really hot mom (played by Natascha McElhone) left the family to live the life she wanted, while his father (Played by Dougray Scott), plays the classic stereotype of an adult who forgot what it was like to be young and is shifting too much responsibility on his son. 

London Town is greatly similar to another Coming-of-Age film, Sing Street (which is a little better), as Shay allows a crush on a punk rock girl to greatly influence his walk down the path of punk, which leads him to meeting Joe Strummer. 

The film's formula is very direct, and it's focus on punk rock makes it a perfect persona of the early days of the genre. It's a love letter to The Clash any fan would enjoy.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2285,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2016-10-07","keywords":"the clash,pantyhose,miniskirt,fishnet pantyhose,losing virginity","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3651909145","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 70's London, a teenager is introduced to The Clash by his estranged mother and it changes his life forever.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001667/","name":"Jonathan Rhys Meyers","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4948519/","name":"Daniel Huttlestone","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779084/","name":"Dougray Scott"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0097517/","name":"Derrick Borte"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0296298/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030755/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0375102/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0114226/","name":"Matt Brown","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0839503/","name":"Sonya Gildea","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792202/","name":"Kirsten Sheridan"],"duration":"PT1H32M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Piąte: Nie odchodź!
programme.desc: 15-letniej Romie (Michalina Olszańska) umiera matka. Dziewczyna nie może sobie z tym poradzić. Ojciec, wzięty psychiatra Andrzej (Łukasz Simlat), jej tego nie ułatwia, gdyż jest pochłonięty pracą. Nastolatka znajduje ukojenie w intensywnych treningach tańca. Pewnego dnia spotyka małomównego mężczyznę, który wprowadził się do domu w sąsiedztwie.

programme.title: Sufit
Katto
programme.desc: Olavi (Juho Milonoff) się rozwodzi. Szukając zapomnienia od związanych z tym nieprzyjemnych okoliczności, przyjeżdża do letniego domku. Na miejscu się przekonuje, że sufit w tajemniczy sposób się obniżył.

programme.title: Raoul Taburin
Tajemnica Raoula Taburina
Raoul Taburin
programme.desc: Raoul Taburin: Directed by Pierre Godeau. With Benoît Poelvoorde, Edouard Baer, Suzanne Clément, Victor Assié. Raoul Taburin is the story of a little boy who has grown up without knowing how to ride a bike. The story of an immense misunderstanding lived as a curse. An impostor despite himself." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7831674/","name":"Raoul Taburin","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjc2NzY1ZTQtN2YyYi00MWJkLThlODUtYTM5ZDg2NjFiMWY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc5OTMwOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Raoul Taburin is the story of a little boy who has grown up without knowing how to ride a bike. The story of an immense misunderstanding lived as a curse. An impostor despite himself.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7831674/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FrenchEddieFelson"},"dateCreated":"2019-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"A humble family movie","reviewBody":"A film gathering Benoît Poelvoorde, Edouard Baer, Suzanne Clément, and inspired from a comic strip of the genial Sempé, it's clearly an offer you can't refuse! Nevertheless, processing a comic into a movie is usually a perilous exercise, due to the probable distorsion of the global atmosphere, with a wide spectrum of divergent opinions on this particular subject. In my humble opinion, the result is rather successful thanks to the magic complicity of the duet Poelvoorde / Baer. I was particularly sensitive to these themes: simplicity, friendship, humility, benevolence and love. programme.desc: Perfect Skin: Directed by Kevin Chicken. With Richard Brake, Natalia Kostrzewa, Kasia Koleczek, Perry Jaques. Katia Matuschak, 18, a Romanian ex-au pair is now adrift in London. He soon discovers what he is hunting might not be human." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105459/","name":"Split Second","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2I2ZjBmMWEtMTVkZC00OTVkLWE1MjktOTc0MDgwNzZhYmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a flooded future London, Detective Harley Stone hunts a serial killer who murdered his partner, and has haunted him ever since. He soon discovers what he is hunting might not be human.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105459/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"neptune_metal_reviews"},"dateCreated":"2006-05-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"You people make me laugh","reviewBody":"The nerve of some of you. "I was expecting a Hollywood masterpiece" WHAT?? It's a Rutger Hauer movie you mindless spawns of ignorance! For what it was, It was a damn good film. Anyone with a brain knows before buying it, renting it, that it it ain't Oscar material folks. It's a low budget sci-fi that happens to be pretty damn good. I thought the alien was good, and not cheesy or hokie looking, the idea of the flooding and constant raining was pretty clever, and the time frame was believable to me. Lighten up losers. This "B flick" blows away a lot of "A flicks" see "War Of The Worlds". Yes, different strokes for different folks, but those of you who thought this flick was a waste of time, should't be renting sci-fi videos but probably should be sticking to your typical mainstream cinema, you know the stuff you think is so "movie genius", like Broke back Mountain.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13759,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Horror"],"datePublished":"1992-06-05","keywords":"serial killer,global warming,london england,creature,water","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000442/","name":"Rutger Hauer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000326/","name":"Kim Cattrall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0241885/","name":"Alastair Duncan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0562699/","name":"Tony Maylam"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103626/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0025854/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019350/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0860155/","name":"Gary Scott Thompson"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Speak
Ucieczka w milczenie
Speak
programme.desc:
Speak: Directed by Jessica Sharzer. With Kristen Stewart, Elizabeth Perkins, Richard Hagerman, Allison Siko. After a blurred trauma over the summer, Melinda enters high school a selective mute. Struggling with school, friends, and family, she tells the dark tale of her experiences, and why she has chosen not to speak." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0378793/","name":"Speak","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg4MzY0NzUzMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwOTE4Mjc2._V1_.jpg","description":"After a blurred trauma over the summer, Melinda enters high school a selective mute. Struggling with school, friends, and family, she tells the dark tale of her experiences, and why she has chosen not to speak.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0378793/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Filmcritic624"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not your typical teen movie","reviewBody":"This finally aired on Lifetime yesterday, and since I was such a big fan of Laurie Halse Anderson's novel, I might as well wanted to see the movie to compare them.

The first few minutes of the movie turned out to be exactly pages from the book, as well as some emotional moments that almost reduced me to tears, showed exactly the way she was feeling, and how she was connected from the moment to the school year in such depressive, mute fashion that she manages to handle so well. The story involves a teenage girl who, after calling the cops to bust a wrecked summer party, comes to acknowledge her peers won't talk to her anymore. So, what do you do when times like these come to happen? Stay silent, don't get noticed by anyone. However, there was something at the party that she doesn't want people to know, and if she tells it, it will rip and shed her into pieces. Now, your probably asking yourself? Why wouldn't you talk to your parents? She would, only that her mom (Elizabeth Perkins) and dad (D.B. Sweeney) are almost never home so that way they can talk to her about anything.

As the movie goes on, Melinda (Kirsten Stewart) begins to lighten up around the surroundings. She starts to feel into her own, and the school year (besides the fact her grades went flushing down the toilet). Melinda starts to make friends little by little, as she connects with her eccentric Art teacher Mr. Freeman (Steve Zahn). The two of them exemplify what it means to try and go against what is asked of them, and go above that to raising the bar to a whole new level of education, and life.

As for the acting, Stewart is extraordinary as the reclusive Melinda Sordino. She fits the feelings of a depressed girl, striving for help, and need from peers, not harmful words. She makes herself known around the school, as "the girl who busted Kyle Rodgers's summer party" and shows it around by the depressive acts (cutting (both class and self mutilation), making her own room, being practically mute). Stewart has the absolute potential to be another Lindsay Lohan, but in this case, she's become her own actress.

The rest of the cast could have been better, but the second runner up is Steve Zahn, whose films could have seen better days, but this film is probably his best work, compared to "Saving Silverman" or "Freak talks about Sex". He should make films like these more often than not. His portrayal of the rebellious, journeyman Mr. Freeman tell the students about themselves, and tells a small anecdote about him. His overshadowing of the students make him sound more powerful than the principal himself, and his voice strengthen amongst the weaker ones.

Powerful movie, I recommend this to anyone with teenagers, or any educational film. This is a worth to watch.

8/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":25778,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2004-01-20","keywords":"art,high school,teacher,depression,title directed by female","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0829576/","name":"Kristen Stewart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001610/","name":"Elizabeth Perkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0353527/","name":"Richard Hagerman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0789366/","name":"Jessica Sharzer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0133326/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1547881/","name":"Laurie Halse Anderson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0789366/","name":"Jessica Sharzer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1022687/","name":"Annie Young Frisbie"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Devil Winds
Diabelskie wiatry
Devil Winds
programme.desc: Devil Winds: Directed by Gilbert M. Shilton. With Joe Lando, Nicole Eggert, Erica Durance, Pete Graham. A brilliant meteorologist returns to his hometown in Oklahoma to try to stop the biggest tornado ever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0382637/","name":"Devil Winds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAzODU5Nzg2NjdeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDUwOTg5MDMx._V1_.jpg","description":"A brilliant meteorologist returns to his hometown in Oklahoma to try to stop the biggest tornado ever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0382637/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SimonJack"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A good job of weaving CGI into real storm formations","reviewBody":"Although CGI was needed for a film like this, "Devil Winds" manages to weave it in seamlessly with considerable real film footage of forming storms. The result is some action with nature on the rampage that comes very close to reality. The reality of CGI is still in the back of one's mind, but it doesn't overpower the video action taking place. So, one has a sense of watching the real terror of nature on the rampage in a tornado.\n\nAnd, that is the best thing about and reason for watching this film. The cast are all okay, but nothing special, and the plot is so-so. It's too bad that the producers couldn't use some real funnel footage - it's out there, and I've seen it on news casts and on videos. I've also watched real tornadoes myself from a distance. Still, the storm action and tracking scenes are the reason for watching this movie that was made for TV.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":390,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2003-11-01","keywords":"disaster movie,disaster film,oklahoma,tornado,storm chaser","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Devil Winds","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi178389273","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzZiMTI2YzUtMDc4Yy00MDI5LWE0OWQtM2RjOTA0NmEyOTU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzZiMTI2YzUtMDc4Yy00MDI5LWE0OWQtM2RjOTA0NmEyOTU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0484880/","name":"Joe Lando"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001176/","name":"Nicole Eggert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1570568/","name":"Erica Durance"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0793525/","name":"Gilbert M. So, one has a sense of watching the real terror of nature on the rampage in a tornado.\n\nAnd, that is the best thing about and reason for watching this film. The cast are all okay, but nothing special, and the plot is so-so. It's too bad that the producers couldn't use some real funnel footage - it's out there, and I've seen it on news casts and on videos. I've also watched real tornadoes myself from a distance. Still, the storm action and tracking scenes are the reason for watching this movie that was made for TV.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":390,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.3,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2003-11-01","keywords":"disaster movie,disaster film,oklahoma,tornado,storm chaser","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Devil Winds","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi178389273","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzZiMTI2YzUtMDc4Yy00MDI5LWE0OWQtM2RjOTA0NmEyOTU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzZiMTI2YzUtMDc4Yy00MDI5LWE0OWQtM2RjOTA0NmEyOTU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0484880/","name":"Joe Lando","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001176/","name":"Nicole Eggert","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1570568/","name":"Erica Durance"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0793525/","name":"Gilbert M. programme.title: Riverworld
Świat rzeki
Riverworld
programme.desc: Riverworld: Directed by Kari Skogland. With Brad Johnson, Karen Holness, Emily Lloyd, Jeremy Birchall. Hale, an American astronaut dies and is reincarnated with other persons who have lived throughout all of human history and end up on a mysterious planet called 'Riverworld'. The humans are left to their own devices and create tribal fiefdoms and succumb to brutal wars and raids. A mysterious race of hooded 'beings' oversee them - sometimes intervening, but their motives are unknown. Anyone who has ever lived and died on Earth comes here rather than 'the afterlife', even an extra-terrestrial call Monat, who had the unfortunate luck of dying on Planet earth in 2039. Hale leads a revolt and joins with others on a large boat to explore this mysterious new world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0310952/","name":"Riverworld","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQyMTQyMjg4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjM0OTYyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Hale, an American astronaut dies and is reincarnated with other persons who have lived throughout all of human history and end up on a mysterious planet called 'Riverworld'. The humans are left to their own devices and create tribal ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0310952/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"notmicro"},"dateCreated":"2003-04-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Horrible travesty of the books","reviewBody":"I was looking forward to this one, and was totally disgusted by the results; its like yet another pseudo-scifi "product" extruded from the studios of New Zealand. Except that compared to this thing, Hercules and Xena are highbrow entertainment! Sci-fi for the McDonald's generation. The script includes a jumble of maybe about 15% of the entire original lively and inventive story from the first two books, tosses the other 85%, and replaces it with childish claptrap like evil warlords pursing the virtuous blonde maiden -- and will she escape their clutches??? Yeah, really had me on the edge of my seat. I was expecting the villain to grow a mustache he could twirl, and tie her to some railroad tracks -- spare me! I'd give it a '2' for story, and a '6' for production-values.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2443,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"genre":["Fantasy","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2003-03-22","keywords":"nero,emperor,alien,time,spaceship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424635/","name":"Brad Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0392228/","name":"Karen Holness"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000503/","name":"Emily Lloyd"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0804556/","name":"Kari Skogland"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0388385/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073776/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1178457/","name":"Philip Jose Farmer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371955/","name":"Stuart Hazeldine"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

Militia
programme.desc: Militia: Directed by Jim Wynorski. With Dean Cain, Jennifer Beals, Frederic Forrest, Stacy Keach. An ATF agent goes undercover to retrieve stolen anthrax missiles." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0217654/","name":"Militia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNDU0MTc3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTU0MTkxMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ATF agent goes undercover to retrieve stolen anthrax missiles.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0217654/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Slacker-21"},"dateCreated":"2000-08-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Gave up after 30 minutes","reviewBody":"I stopped watching this film after the first 30 minutes, in part because I couldn't believe the barefaced theft of the anthrax-stealing scenes from TERMINATOR 2. How is it that only one other commenter noticed this?\n\nThe other killer was the supposedly high-tension scene involving the ATF and the military officers. I haven't seen such a badly played-out display of machiso since LOST IN SPACE."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":797,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure"],"keywords":"bar,explosion,undercover,fistfight,bomb","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Militia","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2811625753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2E4YTA0ODItYzVhNi00NjI3LTkwYzYtNWJjYjUxOWE5YjAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2E4YTA0ODItYzVhNi00NjI3LTkwYzYtNWJjYjUxOWE5YjAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Avalanche"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001002/","name":"Dean Cain"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000884/","name":"Jennifer Beals"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002078/","name":"Frederic Forrest"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691061/","name":"Jim Wynorski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0081580/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0490370/","name":"Steve Latshaw"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0676248/","name":"Fred Olen Ray"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Con Express
Ekspres śmierci
Con Express
programme.desc: Con Express: Directed by Terry Cunningham. With Sean Patrick Flanery, Arnold Vosloo, Ursula Karven, Eyal Podell. Agent Brooks tells his side of a botched job at a job interview for for the Head of Customs in Alaska. He takes a tip that a shipment of bio-weaponry is coming in and discovers a Russian terrorist, Simeonov, is behind it. Brooks assembles a team and they go down to the docks to check the tip out. There a shoot-fest follows, an undercover FBI agent surfaces and a Russian agent, Natalya arrives to claim rights over Simeonov. Simeonov is arrested but while being transferred to Washington he escapes and with his fellow terrorists hijack the train carrying the stolen Russian nerve gas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0310907/","name":"Con Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NDEwOTU3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzc3NTQ5._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Brooks tells his side of a botched job at a job interview for for the Head of Customs in Alaska. He takes a tip that a shipment of bio-weaponry is coming in and discovers a Russian terrorist, Simeonov, is behind it. Brooks asse","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0310907/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JimmyL5555"},"dateCreated":"2006-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"very weak action picture.....don't bother","reviewBody":"The entire movie is set in Flashback mode as an agent tells his superiors what happened in a Russian biochemical weapon terrorist transaction aboard a train that resulted in a huge folder of paperwork. The movie takes a while to get going, but once it does, you ride on the wave, and it doesn't get any faster than 2nd gear. Footage from the 1985 Eric Roberts' movie "Runaway Train" is used, and you kind of wish your were watching THAT movie instead. There is very little, if any, suspense, and it's a total waste of two hours. If you want to see this kind of story done well with edge-of-your-seat suspense, I'd recommend "Under Siege 2: Dark Territory" and "Atomic Train".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":462,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action"],"datePublished":"2002-11-22","keywords":"hijack,train,die hard scenario,m16 gun,m 16","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cons Express","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi599720217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2I0OGExYWMtMDYxOS00ZjMxLThjODctMWI3YjY2OTBkMThhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2I0OGExYWMtMDYxOS00ZjMxLThjODctMWI3YjY2OTBkMThhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001218/","name":"Sean Patrick Flanery"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0903677/","name":"Arnold Vosloo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0440291/","name":"Ursula Karven"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192463/","name":"Terry Cunningham"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027550/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0083590/","name":"Paul A. Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!
programme.desc: Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!: Directed by Anthony C. Ferrante. With Ian Ziering, Tara Reid, Cassandra Scerbo, Frankie Muniz. A monstrous tornado unleashes ravenous sharks from Washington, D.C., all the way down to Orlando, Florida." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3899796/","name":"Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc5MDUzNzQzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDg4NTYzNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A monstrous tornado unleashes ravenous sharks from Washington, D.C., all the way down to Orlando, Florida.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3899796/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"keithlovesmovies"},"dateCreated":"2015-07-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sharknado 3 Review","reviewBody":"Fin (Ian Ziering) and April (Tara Reid) are now remarried and are expecting another child. After a trip to Washington D.C. to receive a medal from current president Marcus Robbins (Marc Cuban) for his heroic actions during the events in the first 2 films, another sharknado strikes destroying the capital. Fearing that his family is in danger, he heads to Orlando. What he doesn't know is that a sharknado is following him while another is attacking Orlando. Now he and those he runs into on the way to Orlando must work together to try to stop the sharknados before they combine to form a sharkicane with the potential to destroy the entire East Coast.\n\nI'll get right to it and say that this movie is terrible but that's not the point here. Everyone probably knew this coming in so I don't think that I'm surprising anyone. The acting is bad, the special effects are bad to the point that they are laughable, and the story doesn't make any sense. I am aware that this movie is called Sharknado 3 so I wasn't expecting anything scientifically accurate. Sharks in space people!!!! I saw some things in this that made me question myself but like I've said, this film is called Sharknado 3 so in order to enjoy it, you just have to suspend belief and accept what you are being given. My favorite thing about the film is all the random shark kills in all their "semi-gory" glory (this is a TV movie so they can only go so far). You'll also be surprised by some of the people who get killed (no spoilers). Common sense would normally dictate not watching this but if you give it a chance you'll be pleasantly surprised and perhaps entertained as I was. I've seen the first 2 films and I enjoyed them a lot and I think that this one is the best one so far.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12465,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.1},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-07-22","keywords":"third part,creature feature,shark,space shuttle,nasa","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3641750297","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDFjYzAzMmItODRmMy00NWZjLWJkYjgtNmVjY2Y2ZDVlNDIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDFjYzAzMmItODRmMy00NWZjLWJkYjgtNmVjY2Y2ZDVlNDIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005575/","name":"Ian Ziering"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005346/","name":"Tara Reid"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2628561/","name":"Cassandra Scerbo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003116/","name":"Anthony C. programme.title: Anaconda: Offspring
Anakonda 3: Potomstwo
Anaconda III
programme.desc:
Anaconda: Offspring: Directed by Don E. FauntLeRoy. With David Hasselhoff, Crystal Allen, Ryan McCluskey, Patrick Regis. A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1137996/","name":"Anaconda: Offspring","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGY5MDI5Y2ItNDk2MS00NzJlLWJmMTEtNGYwM2Y4ZjU2MjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1137996/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"player_pawn"},"dateCreated":"2008-09-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Where's the Hoff?","reviewBody":"When a film features David Hasselhoff and his crack team of snake-fighting mercenaries facing off against a 60-foot-long genetically altered anaconda before the opening credits even roll, any fan of B-movie cheese can arguably presume they're in for a good time. Hasselhoff's self-deprecating humor and strange otherworldly charm make him an endearing punchline, and also translates well into the world of Sci Fi Channel stardom. Sadly, after that opening scene, The Hoff all but disappears for the next 45 minutes of the film, and what starts with campy reptile-killin' fun quickly spirals into boring laboratory diatribes about the dangers of gene manipulation and the real-world uses of unlikely immortality drugs.

Although the ads would lead one to believe otherwise, ANACONDA III actually centers on Amanda (Crystal Allen), a scientist who works for Universal Bio-Tech and the nefariousand appropriately namedMurdoch (John Rhys-Davies, obviously still fuming over not being included in the new Indiana Jones film). It seems that he's been playing God with the reptilian world and has somehow managed to create an anaconda that's not only larger and angrier than any snake on Earth, but sports a three-foot machete growing out of its tail. This Ginsu butt comes into play numerous times during the film, and while the results are always spectacularly gory, a serpent's bladed posterior is inescapably difficult to take seriously.

Since all B-movie snakes carry the cure for (insert disease here), another round of unethical testing is underway, and it isn't long before our slithering behemoth breaks out of its cage, knocks off everyone but Amanda and her boss and heads out into the lush green wilderness of Romania. It's only then that Hasselhoff's Hammett and a group of ALIENS space-Marine rejects (resembling the United Colors of Benetton) are hired to eradicate the monster, which has taken up residence in a nearby farmhouse. With that, we've now got the prerequisite team of Special Ops, the cheap sets and the giant CG monster everything required for a yet another weak entry in the recent string of bland Sci Fi Channel originals.

Director Don E. FauntLeroy, who served as DP on the JEEPERS CREEPERS movies and nearly 50 other films, has managed to shoot a good-looking feature, but fills it with every painful cliché imaginable. First-time screenwriters Nicholas Davidoff and David Olson sprinkle in occasionally fun dialogue, but their script is ultimately burdened down with bland characters and extremely corny, uninspired plot twists. Hasselhoff's Hammett, a fun antihero who deserves more screen time (and one-liners), is delegated to a glorified supporting role beneath far less interesting characters. Rhys-Davies, whose cameo appearances work quite well, will hopefully receive a beefier role in ANACONDA IV (the direct sequel shot back to back with this movie, scheduled to debut this December); otherwise, he served virtually no purpose at all. It's only Allen as the spunky Amanda who breathes any life into her role; a surprise, given her lack of substantial film experience prior to headlining this one. Unfortunately, given the material, even she has trouble rising above the movie's stupendous mediocrity. When all is said and done, ANACONDA III should have been a much better film, but it also could have been much worse. The cast is sorely mismanaged, the plot is all over the board and the digital FXparticularly a handful of atrocious greenscreen driving shotsare by-and-large laughable, but the cast and crew obviously worked hard with what little they had. With any luck, this sequel's surviving characters will find more to do in the next entry, and we'll end up with a film that's not just meatier, but more entertaining. A direct-to-cable second follow-up to a creature feature headlined by J. Lo and Ice Cube doesn't need to be a masterpiece, but it should be passable as an evening's fleeting distraction. ANACONDA III is just barely that, but it's still regrettable that something as inherently amusing as David Hasselhoff fighting a giant snake couldn't have ended up just the slightest bit more fun.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7680,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Horror"],"datePublished":"2008-07-26","keywords":"anaconda,snakeskin,psychotronic film,woman wears a gas mask,snake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Anaconda III: Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2085683225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1MDk2NDQ2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzI0OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1MDk2NDQ2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzI0OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001327/","name":"David Hasselhoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1296597/","name":"Crystal Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011675/","name":"Ryan McCluskey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005703/","name":"Don E. FauntLeRoy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020879/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0186146/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1682328/","name":"Nicholas Davidoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2837937/","name":"David C. Olson"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Daylight
Tunel
Daylight
programme.desc:
Daylight: Directed by Rob Cohen. With Sylvester Stallone, Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Dan Hedaya. Disaster in a New York tunnel as explosions collapse both ends of it. One hero tries to help the people inside find their way to safety." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116040/","name":"Daylight","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE5MDkxYzktODU4OS00Yjc4LTk5MjktYzlkY2RjMGVlNjU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDc2NjEyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Disaster in a New York tunnel as explosions collapse both ends of it. One hero tries to help the people inside find their way to safety.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116040/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mgsmoviesniper"},"dateCreated":"2006-09-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fasten your seatbelts and brace yourself for an non-stop thrill ride","reviewBody":"Fasten your seatbelts and brace yourself for an non-stop thrill ride that will have you holding your breath from start to finish.

"Daylight" is one of the most intense movies I have seen in a long time. Sylvester Stallone gives one of his best performances in "Daylight" leading a group of civilians to safety after a New York tunnel engulfs in flames. Stallone works his magic as a former EMS chief sent in to save these civilians.

When I heard Stallone's name mentioned as part of the cast of "Daylight," I knew it would be a non-stop thrill ride; however, what I didn't realize it would be a thriller that had depth mixed in with everything else. "Daylight" is a credit to Stallone's ability and this remains one of his best roles to date.

Adding to this awesome film are Stallone's co-stars, which include Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Jay O. Sanders and Stan Shaw. I enjoyed watching this ensemble work together because they seem to need no direction when on screen. It was as if they were really trapped in the tunnel. From the fear to the heroic actions they took, these actors were top notch.

I concede that "Daylight" is predictable. However, I disagree with those who say it hurts the film. My point is it doesn't matter whether a film is predictable, rather how it is presented. "Daylight" is presented with quite unique special effects, a plot with depth and endearing performances.

In addition to the excellent performances, "Daylight" had some of the best special effects I have seen. The explosion at the beginning of the movie was a work of art. I was in awe of how well the special effects were pulled off because I don't believe that "Daylight" would have worked as well as it did if they were done with less than 100 percent effort.

"Daylight" will keep you on the edge of your seat from start to finish."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70884,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1996-12-06","keywords":"collapsing tunnel,electronic music score,blowout,pistol,director cameo","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000312/","name":"Amy Brenneman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001557/","name":"Viggo Mortensen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003418/","name":"Rob Cohen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062608/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092018/","name":"Leslie Bohem"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0116040, Title: Daylight, --- Description: Daylight: Directed by Rob Cohen. With Sylvester Stallone, Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Dan Hedaya. Disaster in a New York tunnel as explosions collapse both ends of it. One hero tries to help the people inside find their way to safety." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116040/","name":"Daylight","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE5MDkxYzktODU4OS00Yjc4LTk5MjktYzlkY2RjMGVlNjU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDc2NjEyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Disaster in a New York tunnel as explosions collapse both ends of it. One hero tries to help the people inside find their way to safety.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116040/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mgsmoviesniper","dateCreated":"2006-09-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fasten your seatbelts and brace yourself for an non-stop thrill ride","reviewBody":"Fasten your seatbelts and brace yourself for an non-stop thrill ride that will have you holding your breath from start to finish.

"Daylight" is one of the most intense movies I have seen in a long time. Sylvester Stallone gives one of his best performances in "Daylight" leading a group of civilians to safety after a New York tunnel engulfs in flames. Stallone works his magic as a former EMS chief sent in to save these civilians.

When I heard Stallone's name mentioned as part of the cast of "Daylight," I knew it would be a non-stop thrill ride; however, what I didn't realize it would be a thriller that had depth mixed in with everything else. "Daylight" is a credit to Stallone's ability and this remains one of his best roles to date.

Adding to this awesome film are Stallone's co-stars, which include Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Jay O. Sanders and Stan Shaw. I enjoyed watching this ensemble work together because they seem to need no direction when on screen. It was as if they were really trapped in the tunnel. From the fear to the heroic actions they took, these actors were top notch.

I concede that "Daylight" is predictable. However, I disagree with those who say it hurts the film. My point is it doesn't matter whether a film is predictable, rather how it is presented. "Daylight" is presented with quite unique special effects, a plot with depth and endearing performances.

In addition to the excellent performances, "Daylight" had some of the best special effects I have seen. The explosion at the beginning of the movie was a work of art. I was in awe of how well the special effects were pulled off because I don't believe that "Daylight" would have worked as well as it did if they were done with less than 100 percent effort.

"Daylight" will keep you on the edge of your seat from start to finish.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70884,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1996-12-06","keywords":"collapsing tunnel,electronic music score,blowout,pistol,director cameo","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000312/","name":"Amy Brenneman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001557/","name":"Viggo Mortensen"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003418/","name":"Rob Cohen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062608/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092018/","name":"Leslie Bohem"],"duration":"PT1H54M"</script><metacontent="

Go
programme.desc: Go: Directed by Doug Liman. With Katie Holmes, Sarah Polley, Suzanne Krull, Desmond Askew. The aftermath of a drug deal as told from three different points of view." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0139239/","name":"Go","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzJhNGExMDYtMWEyOS00MzMxLWJiYTYtMDYxNTRmNjdjM2VlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The aftermath of a drug deal as told from three different points of view.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0139239/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"socrates4"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Such Great Fun","reviewBody":"After PULP FICTION a lot of films tried to emulate its format. But none came close to matching its success. GO has clear elements of PULP FICTION in it, but it does its own thing at the same time. This is the right way to make a movie that may be inspired by another great film while still branching out on its own.\n\nThe story is great fun from the first frame to the last. The characters are fun and believable and there is a lot of great dialog here. Every time I watch it I continue to be impressed, even still after all these years. It never lets me down and it never once lets up even for a second. Highly recommend.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70095,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1999-04-09","keywords":"multiple storyline,multiple perspectives,drugs,drug deal,sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Go","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1655308569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDk5ZTIzM2MtMjU3MS00ZTgwLWJkYjEtODVmZDk0N2EyNGVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDk5ZTIzM2MtMjU3MS00ZTgwLWJkYjEtODVmZDk0N2EyNGVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001631/","name":"Sarah Polley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001542/","name":"Jay Mohr"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937930/","name":"Scott Wolf"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510731/","name":"Doug Liman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060034/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0041864/","name":"John August"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Showdown
Otwarte karty
Showdown
programme.desc:
Showdown: Directed by Robert Radler. With Billy Blanks, Kenn Scott, Christine Taylor, John Asher. An ex-policeman/school janitor (Billy Blanks) shows a new student (Kenn Scott) how to defend himself from a martial-arts bully." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0111174/","name":"Showdown","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTk2MmIxMzMtODQ3Ni00ZjBkLTljNzQtYThkNjZiM2I5MzJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ex-policeman/school janitor (Billy Blanks) shows a new student (Kenn Scott) how to defend himself from a martial-arts bully.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0111174/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"furcheezi"},"dateCreated":"2007-01-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Worth A Hilarious Watch...","reviewBody":"The previous post hit the nail right on the head with its summary of this movie. I just wanted to elaborate a bit more on the sheer cheese factor of this film because there really is SO much of it to be discussed. Namely though, the music. 

This movie's score seems to consist of exactly two songs: one for the good guys and one for the crazy/psycho cult dojo members (think Cobra Kai + Marilyn Manson). It is HILARIOUS just how repetitive the soundtrack gets and yet, just like an awful car wreck, you just can't look away. 

This movie really is JUST like Karate Kid in terms of of its storyline but the final battle scene takes it all a whole other step further. Not only do the rival teens get to face off in a tournament, but the sensei's end up dueling as well providing for yet ANOTHER opportunity to play the awesomely/disgustingly cheesy "good guy theme" theme. Imagine Mr. Myagi taking on the Cobra Kai sensei but 40x cheesier than what that might be like. 

In closing, a memorable quote from Billy Blanks at the end of the film that should be heeded by all:

"I'M NOT GONNA LET YOU HURT ANY MORE KIDS, LEE!" 

*CUE Cheesy GOOD GUY THEME*

*SPINKICK*

-- THE END --"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1053,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action"],"datePublished":"1993-09-17","keywords":"janitor,final showdown,opening action scene,action violence,hand to hand combat","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2057224985","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQzYTgxNjYtYWRhMi00YWZmLTkxMTUtZDBmZWZlODg5ZTk5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQzYTgxNjYtYWRhMi00YWZmLTkxMTUtZDBmZWZlODg5ZTk5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ex-policeman/school janitor (Billy Blanks) shows a new student (Kenn Scott) how to defend himself from a martial-arts bully."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0087593/","name":"Billy Blanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003702/","name":"Kenn Scott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852132/","name":"Christine Taylor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0705675/","name":"Robert Radler"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013199/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070874/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316736/","name":"Stuart Gibbs"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

Another Life
programme.desc: Another Day: Directed by Jeffrey Reiner. With Shannen Doherty, Max Martini, Julian McMahon, Courtney Kidd. A woman's boyfriend dies in a fire after a fight over the couple's unborn child. After the woman is involved in a drowning accident a few years later, she wakes up on-shore to find that she's living two days before her boyfriend's fatal fire." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0295172/","name":"Another Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwODQ3MDQwNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTA3NzU4Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman's boyfriend dies in a fire after a fight over the couple's unborn child. After the woman is involved in a drowning accident a few years later, she wakes up on-shore to find that she's living two days before her boyfriend's fa","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0295172/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"critterkid_13"},"dateCreated":"2009-05-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A movie I thoroughly enjoy","reviewBody":"A comment i keep seeing about this movie is that the plot at times does not make sense. I have the answer as to why.\n\nThe movie was written by my aunt and uncle, Don MacLeod and Helen Frost. When my aunt and uncle write, they write their movies in a format appropriate for release on the big screen. TV movies require huge amounts of plot to be cut out for the allotted time period. As such, important details were cut out of the movie itself which sometimes made the plot a little hard to follow. programme.title: Con Express
Ekspres śmierci
Con Express
programme.desc: Con Express: Directed by Terry Cunningham. With Sean Patrick Flanery, Arnold Vosloo, Ursula Karven, Eyal Podell. Agent Brooks tells his side of a botched job at a job interview for for the Head of Customs in Alaska. He takes a tip that a shipment of bio-weaponry is coming in and discovers a Russian terrorist, Simeonov, is behind it. Brooks assembles a team and they go down to the docks to check the tip out. There a shoot-fest follows, an undercover FBI agent surfaces and a Russian agent, Natalya arrives to claim rights over Simeonov. Simeonov is arrested but while being transferred to Washington he escapes and with his fellow terrorists hijack the train carrying the stolen Russian nerve gas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0310907/","name":"Con Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NDEwOTU3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzc3NTQ5._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Brooks tells his side of a botched job at a job interview for for the Head of Customs in Alaska. He takes a tip that a shipment of bio-weaponry is coming in and discovers a Russian terrorist, Simeonov, is behind it. Brooks asse","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0310907/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JimmyL5555"},"dateCreated":"2006-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"very weak action picture.....don't bother","reviewBody":"The entire movie is set in Flashback mode as an agent tells his superiors what happened in a Russian biochemical weapon terrorist transaction aboard a train that resulted in a huge folder of paperwork. The movie takes a while to get going, but once it does, you ride on the wave, and it doesn't get any faster than 2nd gear. Footage from the 1985 Eric Roberts' movie "Runaway Train" is used, and you kind of wish your were watching THAT movie instead. There is very little, if any, suspense, and it's a total waste of two hours. If you want to see this kind of story done well with edge-of-your-seat suspense, I'd recommend "Under Siege 2: Dark Territory" and "Atomic Train".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":462,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action"],"datePublished":"2002-11-22","keywords":"hijack,train,die hard scenario,m16 gun,m 16","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cons Express","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi599720217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2I0OGExYWMtMDYxOS00ZjMxLThjODctMWI3YjY2OTBkMThhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2I0OGExYWMtMDYxOS00ZjMxLThjODctMWI3YjY2OTBkMThhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001218/","name":"Sean Patrick Flanery"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0903677/","name":"Arnold Vosloo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0440291/","name":"Ursula Karven"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192463/","name":"Terry Cunningham"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027550/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0083590/","name":"Paul A. IMDb data; ttnr: 0310907, Title: Con Express, --- Description: Con Express: Directed by Terry Cunningham. With Sean Patrick Flanery, Arnold Vosloo, Ursula Karven, Eyal Podell. Agent Brooks tells his side of a botched job at a job interview for for the Head of Customs in Alaska. He takes a tip that a shipment of bio-weaponry is coming in and discovers a Russian terrorist, Simeonov, is behind it. Brooks assembles a team and they go down to the docks to check the tip out. There a shoot-fest follows, an undercover FBI agent surfaces and a Russian agent, Natalya arrives to claim rights over Simeonov. Simeonov is arrested but while being transferred to Washington he escapes and with his fellow terrorists hijack the train carrying the stolen Russian nerve gas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0310907/","name":"Con Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NDEwOTU3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzc3NTQ5._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Brooks tells his side of a botched job at a job interview for for the Head of Customs in Alaska. To End All Wars
programme.desc: To End All Wars: Directed by David L. Cunningham. With Ciarán McMenamin, Robert Carlyle, Kiefer Sutherland, Mark Strong. A true story about four Allied POWs who endure harsh treatment from their Japanese captors during World War II while being forced to build a railroad through the Burmese jungle. Ultimately they find true freedom by forgiving their enemies. Based on the true story of Ernest Gordon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0243609/","name":"To End All Wars","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyMDMxMTExOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzEwMjYyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A true story about four Allied POWs who endure harsh treatment from their Japanese captors during World War II while being forced to build a railroad through the Burmese jungle. programme.title: Daylight
Tunel
Daylight
programme.desc:
Daylight: Directed by Rob Cohen. With Sylvester Stallone, Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Dan Hedaya. Disaster in a New York tunnel as explosions collapse both ends of it. One hero tries to help the people inside find their way to safety." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116040/","name":"Daylight","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE5MDkxYzktODU4OS00Yjc4LTk5MjktYzlkY2RjMGVlNjU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDc2NjEyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Disaster in a New York tunnel as explosions collapse both ends of it. One hero tries to help the people inside find their way to safety.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116040/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mgsmoviesniper"},"dateCreated":"2006-09-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fasten your seatbelts and brace yourself for an non-stop thrill ride","reviewBody":"Fasten your seatbelts and brace yourself for an non-stop thrill ride that will have you holding your breath from start to finish.

"Daylight" is one of the most intense movies I have seen in a long time. Sylvester Stallone gives one of his best performances in "Daylight" leading a group of civilians to safety after a New York tunnel engulfs in flames. Stallone works his magic as a former EMS chief sent in to save these civilians.

When I heard Stallone's name mentioned as part of the cast of "Daylight," I knew it would be a non-stop thrill ride; however, what I didn't realize it would be a thriller that had depth mixed in with everything else. "Daylight" is a credit to Stallone's ability and this remains one of his best roles to date.

Adding to this awesome film are Stallone's co-stars, which include Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Jay O. Sanders and Stan Shaw. I enjoyed watching this ensemble work together because they seem to need no direction when on screen. It was as if they were really trapped in the tunnel. From the fear to the heroic actions they took, these actors were top notch.

I concede that "Daylight" is predictable. However, I disagree with those who say it hurts the film. My point is it doesn't matter whether a film is predictable, rather how it is presented. "Daylight" is presented with quite unique special effects, a plot with depth and endearing performances.

In addition to the excellent performances, "Daylight" had some of the best special effects I have seen. The explosion at the beginning of the movie was a work of art. I was in awe of how well the special effects were pulled off because I don't believe that "Daylight" would have worked as well as it did if they were done with less than 100 percent effort.

"Daylight" will keep you on the edge of your seat from start to finish."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70884,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1996-12-06","keywords":"collapsing tunnel,electronic music score,blowout,pistol,director cameo","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000312/","name":"Amy Brenneman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001557/","name":"Viggo Mortensen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003418/","name":"Rob Cohen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062608/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092018/","name":"Leslie Bohem"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="
